Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Garrett Kochner
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer to replace a refurbished 3-year old Gateway because the sound was going out and it was just old. I love the feel of this computer. The keyboard is really easy to type on, even though the keys aren't backlit. One main reason I bought this was the SonicMaster sound system and number pad because I do a lot of math on my keyboard. The sound is incredible at all volume levels. It's really lightweight which is really nice for portability. If you're looking for a mid-sized laptop with great sound quality, I highly recommend this one. I was going to buy the older version, but instead paid an extra $50 for a newer generation i5 processor. The battery is also great for everything this computer is built to do. A small, yet somewhat convenient thing about this laptop is that the charger is a 2-prong, just in case you don't have any 3-prong outlets like I don't at my apartment.The only downfall about this computer is Windows 8, but that's basically a given.NOTE: If you plan on putting Linux on this computer, be sure to install a grub boot installer. The BIOS for this computer doesn't have grub. Instead it uses UEFI. You'll also have to adjust the boot settings to get it to read the ODD. Other than that, getting it installed is fine.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LAPTOP... GREAT COST
Reviews.Author: Renay Lindsay
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this laptop. Was a little hesitant at first since I've never purchased anything from ASUS before but I heard it was a great brand so decided to give it a try. I must say everything it proclaims to do it does... the i5 processor is really fast, camera works great, watching videos and movies on it is awesome due to it's HD quality and I'm just crazy about the sonic master speaker system (in other words the sound is phenomenal). It's a slim, sleek beautiful laptop, love it's design. It actually turns on in 2 seconds which i found was a little unbelievable at first when i read it but it's TRUE. It never overheats no matter how long it's been running, it's IceCool. I felt as if i won the lotto finding a laptop with great specs as this for this price. Windows 8 however is a pain but it's just a matter of getting use to.Overall I Love this laptop. I would DEFINITELY recommend it :)

Reviews.Title: I really don't understand why this has such a bad rating
Reviews.Author: Raphael Castaneda
Reviews.Content: I thought this laptop was pretty dang good. Maybe because it was better than my old laptop, an HP G6 that was horrid. I'm pretty okay with Windows 8, and all I had to do was get used to the new alien OS. It's light for its size (then again, my G6 was pretty thick) and its drives contain 1TB of hard drive space, no less. It stays cool.  I occasionally play Minecraft, which I have modded into oblivion, and it STILL stays relatively cold. For people with "streaming issues," I'm pretty sure it's your crap-tastic WiFi / Intenet connection, and you shouldn't blame it on the machine. The boot up is pretty fast for me, and I can start using the internet within 10-15 seconds. (Old one took 90-210 secs). Like most reviews, the sound system, the SonicMaster is a dream. Very clear audio. I never got prompts from Windows to install MSN or whatever, and the only "unknown" software it had pre installed were some Asus apps and features, so I don't know how someone got that problem. The buttons worked for me. Maybe some people didn't press the "fn" or "function" button before they pressed the function keys, which have more than one purpose, for example, f11 gave me fullscreen while just tapping it, but fn+f11 brought the volume down. Only issue I have with it is that the mousepad's clicker is also part of the mousepad, so if you brush the clicker, it also moves the mouse, but this issue is only personal preference. In all, I'm VERY happy with my new laptop and I would recommend it to others. To the people who had some nightmarish problems, maybe you just got a defective product or something, because I'm living a happy life with this.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT VALUE
Reviews.Author: Reese S. Rickards
Reviews.Content: My high tech adviser recommended three brands before I purchased, Asus one of them.  It replaces a 6 or 7 year old HP laptop.  I chose the Asus because it is one of the very few laptops still offering an optical drive.  Buyers of any brand should not assume they'll be able to load programs from CDs, burn discs, or watch DVDs when they order.  Look carefully at the photo of the product on the Amazon pages to make certain there is an optical drive shown.After using this new machine for a couple weeks I find the hardware friendly and easy to use.  How well it stands up to my relatively light use will be apparently in 6 months or a year.Now, buyers of new computers like this should know in advance they will be getting the Windows 8 operating system.  Note; 8 and not 8.1 which fixes some of the gremlins in the initial release.  Microsoft offers new buyers a free download of 8.1, but not without a ton of downloading.First, the owner has to go online and download all the updates for Windows 8.  (My machine needed about 5 hours to complete the task.)  Then, and only then, can you go to the app store and begin another long download of Windows 8.1.  But be prepared, these latest versions of the Windows OS is nothing like recent MS operating systems.  Think smart phone and pad.  The Asus I purchased does not have a touch screen, largely because I like a mouse.Overall, this seems to be a topnotch computer but remember that after delivery you have to go through the tangled briars of Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Great For the $$$
Reviews.Author: David A. Ames
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son, who runs high graphic & memory hogging games. It works great for him. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: Jose Ramirez
Reviews.Content: The shipping was fast, and nice package, brand new laptop, fast as expected, and fulfilled my expectations when it comes to gaming and other necessities

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: John D. Schafer
Reviews.Content: Love the lap topThe machine is wonderful, screen size good for my old eyes However, I do not like being forced into windows 8. It seems overly  complicated. Would have loved to stick with xp.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: It does what I need it to do and is very fast. I am able to finish my work and still be able to play my games also.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Sara Kemper
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new laptop after my old refurbished one decided to die a few years ago, and this was my gift to me! It's the best thing I think I've ever bought computer wise and when I purchased it it was on sale by a hundred bucks!The only thing I didn't expect was the material the cover was made from, but I can easily live with that!

Reviews.Title: Really great buy!!
Reviews.Author: halon
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of Asus computers. They are always high quality and they work nearly perfectly. I play lots of games like Skyrim, Fallout, Assassin's Creed and Mass Effect etc., and they all run perfectly on this computer! One of the best features is the cooling system  mostly because it actually works but also because it works amazingly well. I can have this laptop plugged in and running multiple apps the entire day and it never heats up. The only time it did heat up (very minimally) was when I used it on my bed on top of the comforter with nothing separating it. I work from home so this is a huge plus for me! The sound quality is outstanding and I love how you can set the audio for what you are doing i.e, music, gaming, movies, etc. The sound is crisp and clean and the gaming option makes the audio in games very robust. The webcam works excellent as well, very good quality. My one and only complaint about this machine is that it has Windows 8 on it. For those of you who do not know this Windows 8 is absolutely terrible. 100% not user friendly, the updates take forever and make you set everything up all over again and go through quite a lengthy process just to be able to use the computer. Windows 8 is brought to us by the same idiots that created Windows Vista, and we all know what an atrocity that was. It takes some getting used to and at first Windows 8 is very very frustrating. The shipping was also great .It arrived 1 day early with no damage. All in all this computer is pretty rad. If you game, work from home or just want to watch movies on it, it will perform admirably nearly every time. I could not have asked for a better laptop at this price. WELL worth the price!!! Honestly I think it should've been more expensive for the excellent quality but that is typical Asus. Spectacular computers at an even better price,

Reviews.Title: Love Asus Period
Reviews.Author: Green Monkey
Reviews.Content: This is solid design and perfect for my needs.Very few laptops come with disk drives.I like having dvdrom in the case I cannot buy digital versions of software.Just like have hard copies of things for example records.

Reviews.Title: Great PC....could use better battery
Reviews.Author: MC_King13
Reviews.Content: Like the PC. Windows 8 isn't that hard to get used to. My only complaint is the battery life.  Had an Asus a couple years ago with a 6-7hr battery life and this is about 3hr (with factory settings)

Reviews.Title: Do not buy an ASUS laptop
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The hinge mechanism is faulty workmanship. I bought the laptop in August 2013. The hinge broke and because it is molded to the LCD, ASUS is expecting me to pay $165 as well as shipping ($30.00) for the repair. ASUS will not stand by its warranty even though the hinge initially broke after my owning it only 2 weeks. I have never written a negative review before. However, my frustration with ASUS is extremely high. Repeated emails from a local computer repair man, who is officially sanctioned by ASUS for repairs, have not resulted in anything. He, also, has decided to break all ties with ASUS after this incident.

Reviews.Title: Lightning fast laptop. Loving it.
Reviews.Author: Rajat S.
Reviews.Content: I really liked the laptop. It truly says that it just On's in 2 seconds and it really does, I really liked it. Initially i faced the issue with the spacebar button which was not working fine. But the excellent amazon customer service made it to change in 1 day only and made me happy. I really recommend everyone to buy any item from amazon insipite of going to any other shops such as bestbuy etc. as i personally do not feel then reliable. I bought my samsung note 3 from best buy 3 months back and started facing issues with the charger, When i visited best buy samsung counter for help they declined to help and said to contact customer care. I was thinking t hat if i would have bought that from amazon then i would have never faced this kind of issue.

Reviews.Title: ASUS X550LA-DH51 15.6-Inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: JRJ
Reviews.Content: Pain learning Microsoft 8.  Don't care for the strange behavior of the mouse pad, I'll get used to it eventually.

Reviews.Title: Good, decently-priced, well-equipped laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for college. This was a replacement for a previous laptop from another manufacturer which has proved less than reliable.The Asus has much better system specs than her other laptop, and performs very well. Only downside is that it comes with Windows 8, but I chose to leave it that way rather than backdating to Win 7. She might as well learn to use Win 8.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic computers
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Adams "mja"
Reviews.Content: This is the second ASUS we have purchased in the last year; this one for my wife and her business (restaurant.) I have the same computer in an I7 processor and this one is an I5 with more disc and memory than mine came in. It seems just as fast as mine! Works very fast with Quickbooks Pro and her other business software. I also bought one of their wireless routers, great product also. Cannot go wrong with this brand!

Reviews.Title: Terrible product, terrible service from ASUS
Reviews.Author: Catherine Dombroski
Reviews.Content: This product is not even 60 days old and needs another hardware repair.  Asus has terrible support.  They are sending a label so that my "new" laptop can be out for service for another week.  Unless you want to deal with frustrating on-line support and returning your product for service and having it unavailable buy another laptop, from another manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Pure awesome
Reviews.Author: Ronnie T
Reviews.Content: I desided to get this after my last PC died, little did I know that this laptop was so powerful, it was equal to, if not more powerful, than my previous PC, an at such an amazing price!

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced laptop with some issues
Reviews.Author: P. Maheshwari
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop in Dec 2013 to replace a 5-year old Sony Vaio which had started to show age. I wanted a 15" laptop with a fast processor, 8 GB RAM, good battery life, and as lightweight as possible. This ASUS laptop fit the bill and seemed like a good deal at just under $650. My biggest shock was using Windows 8. I had Windows Vista on my Sony Vaio and had no idea how drastically Microsoft had changed Windows (for the worse!). Upgrading to Windows 8.1 didn't help either and I would curse Microsoft every time I used the ASUS laptop. Unfortunately, I had to have Windows for iTunes to work with iPhone5s. I finally took the plunge and was able to successfully do a clean installation of Windows 7 after countless hours of tweaking and research. This laptop has UEFI instead of BIOS which makes things very difficult. To install any other OS you have to first disable Fast Boot, enable CSM and Turn Secure Boot off in the BIOS/UEFI which can be accessed by pressing F2 key. I chose to completely wipe off Windows 8.1 and the various recovery partitions and re-partitioned the hard drive for a clean install. Windows Update was able to get most of the drivers, for the missing ones I went to ASUS site and downloaded them. You can install Ubuntu in a similar fashion. I was able to install Ubuntu 14.04 in the UEFI mode (dual boot configuration) from a LiveUSB with gpt partition.Cons: The touchpad on this laptop is horrible, there is no way to adjust the scrolling speed via ASUS Smart Gesture. It comes with a lot of useless software pre-installed by ASUS (also called bloat ware) which was the reason why I had to do a clean install. I am not too happy with the resolution on this system, max resolution is 1366 x 768, something thatI should have paid more attention to before I bought this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good for small business
Reviews.Author: David Weller
Reviews.Content: Has everything you need to handle any business needs... to include the processing power for heavy applications and web graphics...

Reviews.Title: A good product
Reviews.Author: Delores P.
Reviews.Content: The product is nice thin and light.I chose the black laptop but finger print stains still appear on cover and are not easy to wipe off.The charger when it's plugged into an outlet does not stay in. The plug is too heavy to stay in the up right position.The mouse/tracking pad is a bit hard to press. I'm not sure if it's because this is a new laptop.I would purchase another one if I had to but would definitely change the charger.

Reviews.Title: incredible!
Reviews.Author: JUAN
Reviews.Content: It is  a great laptop: powerfull, reliable, robust design and a amazing perfomance software. Very comfortable keyboard. Single bad ítem: a Little heavy. I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Wade Keusder
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer to run accounting programs which it does without any lag. I wouldn't use it for any intense computing like video editing or gaming, but it makes an excellent work computer and is small enough to be taken home.

Reviews.Title: great lap top
Reviews.Author: Maribel Martinez
Reviews.Content: love this lap top.. i wish it already had all programs installed for office word its primary use would be for my daughter a student. great memory great speed i really dont have any complaints. the sellers description was perfect. i definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Impressed With Asus
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I was holding out in upgrading to a Windows 8 computer for as long as possible, but when my old Samsung laptop finally died I decided to purchase my first Asus product.  After spending hours running updates and installing all of my programs, I must say I'm very impressed with this unit.  It is light weight and fits in my backpack easily and can even handle some light gaming.  I wouldn't label it a "speed demon" but it is still pretty fast.  I feel the price ($599) is reasonable especially with the included warranties that come with it.

Reviews.Title: Love it but....
Reviews.Author: Edwin Vega "Hearts Alike"
Reviews.Content: This really is a great computer. Amazing processing speed, great price and very light. The only one complaint is about the keyboard as it's quite clunky. You really have to hit the I keys hard to make sure the keys come through. In every others way it's perfection

Reviews.Title: Very smart notebook
Reviews.Author: Buz
Reviews.Content: This purchase was a gift. However, from what I've observed, it appears to be a very nice machine and the recipient of this gift has be pleased so far.

Reviews.Title: A great little laptop.
Reviews.Author: Bucko43
Reviews.Content: Have owned this for about a month now and not one issue. Everything runs fine and my wife really uses the heck out of it for her school work. She just loves it. If only it didn't have windows 8 operating system, it would be even better. I hate windows 8.

Reviews.Title: I baught this  for my son for his collage and his like it a lot. He said its wotrh it with the price
Reviews.Author: pratiwi
Reviews.Content: I baught this for my son for his collage and his like it a lot . May be the best computer that I have ever buy.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Lap Top
Reviews.Author: Angella Walters
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this laptop. The keys are easy to  manoeuvre. The  battery life is good, and the light weight of the product.

Reviews.Title: Overall Satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Damien Campos
Reviews.Content: Overall I am satisfied with this laptop. I did have some problems. Windows 8 is not a great O.S., but I have for the most part worked through its problems. My biggest complaint with the laptop itself is the mouse design. The left click is to indistinguishable  from the right. I am constantly accidentally clicking it.Other than that I like the computer and it more than handles my needs.

Reviews.Title: Loving it so far!
Reviews.Author: bookGnome
Reviews.Content: I've had this computer for almost a month now! Love how fast it starts up. Not really a fan of the windows 8 GUI, but for those who love open source software, 'classic shell' will return you to what's most familiar.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: jd
Reviews.Content: Asus is Definitely the best computer brand out there.  This computer is no exception to the quality of their products.  This is the perfect balance of Performance and Price.  I would Highly recommend this Laptop to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Asus. X 550LA-DH51 15.6-inch
Reviews.Author: jill gilson
Reviews.Content: Gift for my grandson to relace his old computer ..He loves it ! Was late arriving due to weather conditions. Made it in tme for Christmas. with time to spare,thus no stressing. Would purchase from same vendor again.Maybe one for myself

Reviews.Title: CANNOT USE
Reviews.Author: Lexi
Reviews.Content: I received this and downloaded Norton Antivirus right away and it still does not work! I cannot get on the internet which makes this computer useless to me. I am very disappointed as I have had an Asus product before.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Computer
Reviews.Author: jack baker
Reviews.Content: I have an ASUS laptop and it is, by far, the worse computer I have ever owned. My ASUS is loaded with features but it's controls are junk. Drag and drop features will, without warning, start wandering all over the screen page. I've had files and folders drop in the wrong places more times than I can count, and commands execute that I didn't instruct.  The mouse pad/button system on this computer is worse than bad.I'd keep shopping.  I have and had Dell and HP computers than gave me far far fewer headaches than my ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: David Mcferren
Reviews.Content: A great graduation present for my son.  He will be excited to have his own and have to share with is sister and mother.

Reviews.Title: Worst product and service ever
Reviews.Author: Jerry G. Hope
Reviews.Content: Purchased the laptop new as a Christmas present, and the machine arrived broken. The computer has a stuck space-bar, which is a known issue with this model.

Reviews.Title: Liked nothing about this computer
Reviews.Author: Karissa Canning
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to even buy this computer, considering what the negative reviews said, but I went against my better judgement. Out of the box it felt very cheap. I booted up and it was incredibly slow. It took longer to load web pages than my old computer which is why I was replacing it in the first place. I immediately regretted the decision, and the final straw was when the volume buttons didn't work on the keyboard. Would not recommend this to anyone. Asus has a good reputation so I will assume thus is just a bad model.

Reviews.Title: its a laptop
Reviews.Author: chitownbidda
Reviews.Content: not very fast with netflix youtube or any streaming for that matter. for the price there's better out there keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Stay away, stay very far away!
Reviews.Author: Diamond Jim "DJ"
Reviews.Content: This is the SLOWEST computer I have had since I owned a 286 unit. I downloaded a program on my HP laptop in 15 minutes. The exact same program on my ASUS, with the same windows system, took 75 minutes to load.Stay away from this snail system.

Reviews.Title: biggest piece of doo-doo to hit the market
Reviews.Author: TP
Reviews.Content: I was gifted with this laptop.  The keyboard is great, the look and feel terrific; however, the screen jumps around in an unstable way whenever you try to scroll around, and the windows 8 software forces apps on you from the windows store and there is NO WAY to get the apps store off the computer.  Plus, at every turn, Microsoft forces you to "signup for or MSN account" to herd you into the cloud whenever you're trying to use skype, or go online, or try any of the apps that they force you to face everytime you open your laptop.  This is the most pervasive, intrusive, marketing campaign ever known to man.  You, the user, become their walking billboard for whatever they want to sell.  When I addressed these issues with tech support, neither company would respond with any solutions whatsoever.  Do yourself a favor-- skip this purchase.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i5-4200U 1.6 GHz
8 GB DDR3
1024 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen
Windows 8, 5-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS X550LA-DH51 15.6-Inch Laptop (Silver Grey)
